location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Nicholas Hankey Smith, Resident at Bushire to Neil Benjamin Edmonstone, Secretary in the Secret, Political and Foreign Department, Fort William, Calcutta

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage which has partially obscured the date and signature of the letter. However, it is still possible to identify the author.

mods.abstract: The letter is forwarding intelligence the Resident has gathered for the quarter via HMS Pitt. Topics discussed include the movement of two French officers that are believed to be bound for India, the arrival of the Persian Ambassador to Scind [Sindh] with the Vakeels of Meer Gullum Ali Khan at Bushire and Persian efforts to restrict the circulation of reports of French aims and activities in the region.The dates of the surrounding correspondence suggests that the date of this letter lies between the 20-28 January 1808.
